name: Potion of Healing
description: This potion’s red liquid glimmers when agitated.
rules: You regain 2d4+2 Hit Points when you drink this potion.

name: Potion of Greater Healing
description: This potion’s red liquid glimmers when agitated.
rules: You regain 4d4+4 Hit Points when you drink this potion.

name: Potion of Superior Healing
description: This potion’s red liquid glimmers when agitated.
rules: You regain 8d4+8 Hit Points when you drink this potion.

name: Potion of Supreme Healing
description: This potion’s red liquid glimmers when agitated.
rules: You regain 10d4+10 Hit Points when you drink this potion.

name: Amulet of the Planes
description: Amulets of the planes were typically circular necklace pendants, fashioned from gray metal and black stone and inscribed with various symbols. On closer inspection, they resembled a swirling mass of dark color, and gave off a strong conjuration aura.
rules: While wearing this Amulet, you can use an action to name a Location that you are familiar with on another plane of existence. Then make a DC 15 Intelligence check. On a successful check, you cast the Plane Shift spell. On a failure, you and each creature and object within 15 feet of you Travel to a random destination. Roll a d100. On a 1-60, you Travel to a random Location on the plane you named. On a 61-100, you Travel to a randomly determined plane of existence.

name: Adamantine Armor
description: This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existance.
rules: While wearing this armor, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.
subtype: medium or heavy, but not hide

name: Demon Armor
description: This suit of armor is spiked, studded, and covered in blades, an itimidating sight.
rules: While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC, and you can understand and speak Abyssal. In addition, the armor's clawed gauntlets turn unarmed strikes with your hands into magic weapons that deal slashing damage, with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls and a damage die of 1d8. Curse: Once you don this cursed armor, you can't doff it unless you are targeted by the remove curse spell or similar magic. While wearing the armor, you have disadvantage on attack rolls against demons and on saving throws against their spells and special abilities.
